alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Del Norte Vicinity, Northern San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 1:13AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Virga showers causing strong gusty winds across the San Luis Valley... At 109 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking numerous virga showers over the San Luis Valley. These virga showers were causing strong gusty winds over the region. At 1 AM, winds were gusting over 50 mph at the Alamosa Airport. In addition to the strong winds, the temperature rose to 70 degrees at the Alamosa airport. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... All of the San Luis Valley region. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
